pullRequest.body:
We use the standard definition, with respect to the preferred charts at each point.

Open-ness of the interior is non-trivial, hence left to a future PR:
- for instance, in finite dimensions this requires e.g. knowing the homology of spheres, which mathlib doesn't yet have.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: Thanks for writing this PR! All seems quite standard; looks good to me!

TL;DR. This definition seems to be forward compatible with Banach manifolds with boundary.

For the record: there's an established theory of Banach manifolds with boundary and corners also; the openness of the interior and disjointness of interior and boundary still hold in this context. (See e.g. https://arxiv.org/pdf/1910.14580.pdf, Theorem 4.12 (which references the (pay-walled) textbook *Differential topology* by Roig and Dom√≠nguez) for a reference.) Their definition is more specific than mathlib's; they consider a model space `E` given as the intersection of finitely many half-spaces.

Their proof is different from the standard finite-dimensional proof that interior and boundary are independent of the chart (using homology of spheres/Brouwer fixed point theorem).
Thank you for the review!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7262113180/job/19784619564)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7262113180/job/19784620326)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7262113180/job/19784619248)

bors r+
Thanks!
LGTM, thanks!

bors r+
Thanks!

```suggestion
  {M : Type*} [TopologicalSpace M] [ChartedSpace H M]
```
This plays no role in the file.
`I` should be explicit in this definition: otherwise, when you call `IsInteriorPoint x`, there is no way Lean can guess which model space `H` you are using.

no. But if you put this in the `ModelWithCorners` namespace, you can use `I.interior M`, which is probably a good idea. I think essentially all the file should be in the `ModelWithCorners` namespace, for this reason.
That sounds almost as good - I've adopted this now.

```suggestion
lemma interior_union_boundary_eq_univ : (SmoothManifoldWithCorners.interior I M) ‚à™
```

```suggestion
lemma disjoint_interior_boundary :
    Disjoint (SmoothManifoldWithCorners.interior I M) (SmoothManifoldWithCorners.boundary I M) := by
```
That's the standard spelling of disjointess.

```suggestion
lemma disjoint_interior_frontier : Disjoint (interior s) (frontier s) := by
```

For the record: there's an established theory of Banach manifolds with boundary and corners also; the openness of the interior and disjointness of interior and boundary still hold in this context.
